who_should_move_when: Phase 1: If the fire alarm sounds AND fire is on your floor, evacuate immediately. Phase 2: If the alarm sounds but fire is NOT on your floor, prepare to evacuate but wait for instructions from the Fire and Rescue Service or building staff. Phase 3: If instructed by FRS or staff, evacuate using your designated route. Do not evacuate unless fire is on your floor or you are instructed to leave.
alarm_and_alerting_summary: A continuous alarm means fire has been detected. Listen for announcements on the public address system. The Fire Service will direct which floors should evacuate first.
refuges_and_lifts_summary: Evacuation lift (Lift 3, west wing) available for wheelchair users and those who cannot use stairs. Lift is BS EN 81-76 compliant with backup power. Refuges available on all floors (stairwell lobbies behind fire doors). Use refuge intercom (red button) if you need assistance.
routes_summary: Three protected stairwells (A – north, B – south, C – west). Evacuation lift (Lift 3) in west wing for assisted evacuation. Do not use passenger lifts (Lifts 1 and 2) unless told to by Fire Service. Follow signage and floor markings.
